page.title: 14HOUSES
page.content: Most older houses are situated around the Church in a special conservation area.This means that people have to keep their houses as they have always been.Houses in this area are built with Cotswold stone and the roofs are made with Cotswold tiles. There are five particularly interesting houses which are{The Manor House, The Old {Rectory, Halewell Close,The Corner {House}and{The Old Forge.}Parts of all these houses date back to the{15 {Century. To the west of the conservation area some modern houses have been built using reconstituted stone.The older houses in Compton Rise are made entirely out of wood and the more recent ones have been built using concrete blocks.Most of the houses in Compton Rise are owned by the Cotswold District Council.
